intro: Brassica balearica, commonly known as the Balearic mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a distinct mustard-like aroma. The plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the region.
